name: Rufinus of Aquileia
summary: Rufinus of Aquileia was a monk, theologian, and translator who worked in Jerusalem. He was a friend of St. Jerome until they had a falling out over Origen's teachings. He translated many Greek theological works into Latin, including works by Origen, Eusebius, and Basil. He was a friend and supporter of Melania the Elder and played an important role in bringing Eastern theology to the West.
